description: a(n) is the concatenation of the sums of every pair of consecutive digits of n (with a(n) = 0 for 0 <= n <= 9).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: a[n_] := Total /@ Transpose[{Most[id = IntegerDigits[n]], Rest[id]}] // IntegerDigits // Flatten // FromDigits; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 119}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Apr 05 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a053392 :: Integer -> Integera053392 n = if ys == "" then 0 else read ys where   ys = foldl (++) "" $ map show $ zipWith (+) (tail ds) ds   ds = (map (read . return) . show) n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 26 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 07 2000
